alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Johnston; Nash; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nash, northeastern Wake, northeastern Johnston and Franklin Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 1257 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zebulon, or 18 miles north of Smithfield, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisburg, Zebulon, Franklinton, Bailey, Bunn, Wendell, Spring Hope, Middlesex, Pilot and Emit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
